Fine-map with ABF

Source: R/ABF.R
ABF.Rd

Conduct statistical (non-functional) fine-mapping with approximate Bayes factor (ABF).

ABF(
  subset_DT,
  PP_threshold = 0.95,
  sample_size = NULL,
  sdY = NULL,
  case_control = T,
  verbose = T
)

Source

  • JB Maller et al., Bayesian refinement of association signals for 14 loci in 3 common diseases. Nature Genetics. 44, 1294–1301 (2012).

  • J Wakefield, A bayesian measure of the probability of false discovery in genetic epidemiology studies. American Journal of Human Genetics. 81, 208–227 (2007).

Examples

# GWAS
data("BST1");
finemap_DT <- ABF(subset_DT=BST1)

#> [1] "+ Preparing sample_size (N) column"
#> [1] "++ Computing effective sample size."

# QTL
locus_dir <- "/sc/arion/projects/pd-omics/brian/Fine_Mapping/Data/QTL/Microglia_all_regions/BIN1"
subset_DT <- data.table::fread(file.path(locus_dir,"/Multi-finemap/BIN1.Microglia_all_regions.1KGphase3_LD.Multi-finemap.tsv.gz"))

#> Error in data.table::fread(file.path(locus_dir, "/Multi-finemap/BIN1.Microglia_all_regions.1KGphase3_LD.Multi-finemap.tsv.gz")): File '/sc/arion/projects/pd-omics/brian/Fine_Mapping/Data/QTL/Microglia_all_regions/BIN1//Multi-finemap/BIN1.Microglia_all_regions.1KGphase3_LD.Multi-finemap.tsv.gz' does not exist or is non-readable. getwd()=='/Users/schilder/Desktop/echolocatoR/docs/reference'
finemap_DT <- ABF(subset_DT=subset_DT, case_control=F, sample_size=90)

#> Error in ABF(subset_DT = subset_DT, case_control = F, sample_size = 90): object 'subset_DT' not found
